text:
Hey Angel thats interesting werent you in environments at framestore? How did you come to be in matchmove instead?

I do like Dneg spent a few years there its a lovely place!

You do seem to be doing the right things, it is just tough getting those breaks and modelling seems to be particuarly tricky to break into. Unfortunately theres no magic solution thats going to suddenly make it happen but your attitudes great so iâ€™m sure you will crack it. In my field i had years where i felt like i was going nowhere then some years where i made big leaps so sometimes big opportunities come out of the blue!
Trying smaller companies and having a bigger role in them is worth considering so you can climb up, get a better title and reapply at the big companies in that higher position

Hey craig, oh no I was in layout in framestore but wanted to do modeling. They eventually let me go in modeling but it was to see how I was, then they let me go sadly.  

So now I'm back in matchmove at dneg. Yeah it's hard to move in modeling. Been trying for a year with my reel. I did do modeling for a month in passion but it was freelance.

Yeah its upsetting. I love and enjoy modeling. I did apply to some studios but because I couldn't texture I didnt get a position. So now learning substance,I'm just looking for an opportunity for junior, I work on my stuff everyday after work.
Yeah felt low bring let go. Felt like I was back to square one.
I could have been at milk but it didnt happen. I'm wondering if its something to do with my reel letting me down?
